story01: Robben Island (in English) or Robbeneiland (in Afrikaans) is an island in South Africa, located off Cape Town, 6.9 km west of the coast of Bloubergstrand. UNESCO in 1999, Robben Island was used as a prison, leper colony, psychiatric hospital and military defense post. In the twentieth century, black opponents of the apartheid regime, condemned to long sentences, were interned there, including three future South African presidents (Nelson Mandela, Kgalema Motlanthe and Jacob Zuma).
story02: The Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden is located in the more affluent part of the Cape Town suburb of South Africa. This botanical garden is one of the most renowned in the world thanks to its collections and its exceptional location.
story03: Tsitsikamma National Park is a South African national park located in the Western Cape Province next to Plettenberg Bay. The Tsitsikamma Marine Protected Area (MPA) is the oldest in the world, as it was created in 19641. The park covers an area of ​​298 km2. This park is located on a superb and narrow coastal strip approximately 5 km long on the 70 km of coast bordered on the one hand by the sea and on the other hand by the Garden Route. Tsitsikamma National Park is bounded on its western border by the village of Nature's Valley and on the east by the mouth of the Storms River (Storms River Mouth). The view of the coast from Tsitsikamma National Park is spectacular, especially when the waves are raging.
recipe02: 1 x 2,5 cm piece fresh root ginger
1/2 tsp glycerine (optional for extra shiny koeksisters)
4 cups (4 x 250 ml) High grade flour
recipe03: 1 -2 Chili peppers diced seeds removed for less heat
1 large carrot grated on the large side or sliced thinly
